intro: Leptonema venosum, commonly known as the veiny leptonema, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and delicate, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties. Leptonema venosum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
